sen.j: 増田 宋太郎（ますだ そうたろう、嘉永2年2月23日 (旧暦)（1849年3月17日） - 明治10年（1877年）9月）は、中津藩下士増田久行の嫡男。
sen.e: Sotaro MASUDA (March 17, 1849 - September 1877) is a heir of Hisayuki MASUDA, a noncommissioned officer of the Nakatsu domain.
sen.cmt: 久行：読み方不明です。Hisayuki としました。
sen.e: Sotaro MASUDA (March 17, 1849 - September 1877) is a heir of Hisayuki MASUDA, a noncommissioned officer of the Nakatsu domain.

sen.j: 母は九州国学の三大家の一人、渡辺重名(しげな)の娘。
sen.e: His mother is a daughter of Shigena WATANABE, who is one of the three experts of Kyushu kokugaku (the study of Japanese classical literature).

sen.j: 父は福沢百助の妻のいとこ。
sen.e: His father is a cousin of Momosuke FUKUZAWA's wife.

sen.j: 国学を学び、攘夷思想をもっていた。
sen.e: He studied kokugaku and had anti-foreign thought.
sen.cmt: 攘夷思想：定訳不明です。
sen.e: He studied kokugaku and had the thought of expulsion of foreigners.

sen.j: 福澤諭吉の再従弟に当たり、住まいも近所で親しい交際があったが、明治3年（1870年）、福澤が帰郷した際、寝込みを襲おうと暗殺を企てた。
sen.e: Masuda is a second cousin to Yukichi FUKUZAWA, and they lived close to each other and had close relationship, but in 1870 when Fukuzawa returned home, Masuda attempted to assassinate Fukuzawa in his sleep.

Masuda was a second cousin of Yukichi FUKUZAWA, and they lived close to each other and had a close relationship; however, in 1870 when Fukuzawa returned home, Masuda attempted to assassinate Fukuzawa being asleep.

sen.e: Masuda was a second cousin of Yukichi FUKUZAWA, and they lived close to each other and had a close relationship; however, in 1870 when Fukuzawa returned home, Masuda attempted to assassinate Fukuzawa being asleep.

sen.j: しかし、福澤は来客した服部五郎兵衛と夜通し飲み明かしたためこの計画は失敗している。
sen.e: However, the plan had gone awry because Yukichi was drinking over night with a visitor, Goroemon HATTORI.
However, the plan could not be carried out because Yukichi spent all night drinking with a visitor, Goroemon HATTORI.

sen.j: 維新後は攘夷思想を改め自由民権運動にも参加。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, Masuda amended his anti-foreign thought and joined Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right).
After the Meiji Restoration, Masuda gave up the thought of expulsion of foreigners and joined Jiyu Minken Undo (Movement for Liberty and People's Right).

sen.j: 西南戦争に薩軍側として従軍、中津隊を率いた。
sen.e: He served in the Seinan War as Satsuma Army side, and led Nakatsu-tai Squad.
He participated in the Seinan War on the Satsuma Army side, and led the Nakatsu-tai squad.

sen.j: 和田峠の戦いで敗れた後、西郷が解軍の令を出し、故郷へ帰る隊もある中、西郷に付き従った。
sen.e: After the defeat in the Battle of Wada Pass, Saigo issued an order to dismiss the army, and some squads returned to hometown, but Masuda followed Saigo.

sen.j: 司馬遼太郎も著書で引用した「1日先生に接すれば1日の愛があり、3日接すれば3日の愛がある」とは増田の言葉である。
sen.e: It is Masuda's word that 'If you know Sensei (indicates Saigo, literally means "teacher") for a single day, the love of one day is born. If you know Sensei for three days, the love of three days is born.' which was referred by Ryotaro SHIBA in his book

sen.j: 最後は城山の戦いで戦死したとも捕えられて斬首されたともいう。
sen.e: It is said that he died in the Battle of Shiroyama or he was arrested and decapitated.

sen.j: 太平洋戦争中は、西洋思想を日本に広めた福沢が貶められ、それを暗殺しようとした増田の評価が高まり、生家跡地には神社まで建立されたという。
sen.e: During the Pacific War, Fukuzawa, who spread Western thoughts throughout Japan, was diminished and the reputation of Masuda, who tried to assassinate Fukuzawa, was enhanced so much that a shrine was built on the site of his birthplace.

During the Pacific War, Fukuzawa, who had spread Western thought throughout Japan, was diminished, whereas the reputation of Masuda, who had tried to assassinate Fukuzawa, was much enhanced so that a shrine was built on the site of his birthplace.

sen.e: During the Pacific War, Fukuzawa, who had spread Western thought throughout Japan, was diminished, whereas the reputation of Masuda, who had tried to assassinate Fukuzawa, was much enhanced so that a shrine was built on the site of his birthplace.

sen.j: 戦後、評価は元に戻り、現在、増田の生家跡地は小さな公園になっている。
sen.e: After the war, the reputation turned back and now the site of his birthplace became a small park.
